dublinCore.dc:title: 117 HR 6840 IH: Northern Border Reopening Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Jacobs of New York (for himself, Ms. Stefanik, Mr. Bergman, Mr. Garbarino, Mr. Donalds, Mr. Stauber, and Mr. Zeldin) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on the Judiciary

form.official-title: To prohibit COVID–19 travel restrictions with respect to any nationals of Canada, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Northern Border Reopening Act.

section.header: Prohibiting COVID–19 travel restrictions for Canadian nationals
section.text: Notwithstanding Presidential Proclamation 10294 (86 Fed. Reg. 59603), published October 28, 2021, relating to advancing the safe resumption of global travel during the COVID–19 pandemic, or any other provision of law, neither a suspension nor limitation on entry to the United States shall apply to a national of Canada based on any COVID–19 travel restriction.
